findings.rationale: The employer's perpetual and exclusive license to all work products may limit the employee's future opportunities and rights to their own creations.
findings.evidence_quote: Provider grants Employer a perpetual, exclusive license to use all work product created during employment for Employer's business purposes.

findings.rationale: The one-year non-compete clause may restrict the employee's ability to work in their field post-termination, potentially impacting their career prospects.
findings.evidence_quote: Employee may not compete within the same industry for 1 year after termination, within Employer's service area.

findings.rationale: The ability of either party to terminate the agreement for convenience with only 30 days notice could lead to job insecurity for the employee.
findings.evidence_quote: Either party may terminate for convenience with 30 days written notice.

findings.rationale: Capping indemnification at annual compensation may leave the employee exposed to significant liabilities without appropriate recourse.
findings.evidence_quote: Mutual indemnification: each party indemnifies the other for its own negligence, capped at annual compensation.
